data.title: Removed hard-coded map folders
data.body: #3544 also some leftovers from #3777

data.title: D2K mod: new dialog.png artwork
data.body:
I have added a "hover" state for buttons and modified the texture of buttons.
I just did it for fun, it's not necessary meant to replace the current one (but if you like these changes, then feel free to merge this issue :) )

![dialog](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/1277318/a2b8cad8-2ebb-11e3-9cf0-db3260299a66.png)

chrome.yaml : http://pastebin.com/WiP46z9R

data.title: Can't use hotkeys for building units in Tiberian Dawn mod
data.body:
Hello
I've got an issue with "        Hotkey: ..." in cnc yamls, that I added myself.
They are not working as in Red Alert mod.
e.g.
OpenRA-bleed/mods/cnc/rules/infantry.yaml:
...
    Buildable:
        BuildPaletteOrder: 10
        Owner: gdi, nod
        Hotkey: i
...
But when my barracks built and I press "i" nothing happens.

Best regards,
            Andrew

data.title: Add a "Create Game" button on the IRC lobby window
data.body:
I think there should be a button on the lobby window to be able to create new games.
![1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/1276828/93952f9e-2e96-11e3-8912-c126e14dd8b5.png)

Then it would bring the current server creation windows:
![2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/1276829/970b32f4-2e96-11e3-9d12-60ca45206a23.png)

And finally:
![3](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/1276830/9b55a060-2e96-11e3-8154-2cad6ab7651f.png)

There could also be another button here to Spectate a selected game: 
![04](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/1276882/8b122160-2e9b-11e3-9404-e65496d7a3a7.png)

What do you think about that ?

data.title: RA mod : new dialog.png artwork

The "hover" states are 5% lighter (white) than "normal" buttons.

I have modified many values in the chrome.yaml file for all buttons (corners especially).

http://pastebin.com/ey2RdgQz

data.title: TS mod : new dialog.png artwork

I have tried to modify the dialog.png file for the TS mod.
Here is what I have done:

And I also modified some lines in chrome.yaml (from line 150 to line 159):
dialog: dialog.png

data.title: Fix Mods.RA project file
Fixed cargos exploding where they were loaded
Fixed passable cliffs on Arrakis
Fixed D2k infantry stopping during a firing animation with muzzle flash
Removed Loadscreen redundancy
data.body: for easier modding and code maintenance.

data.title: Content hosting provided by Label during asset download
data.body:
So users can report _which_ mirror is down/slow whatever and also to credit the nice people who donated bandwidth.

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.net.webclient.baseaddress.aspx is probably the thing to expose at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/Download.cs However I somehow I failed to do so myself as async got in my way.

data.title: Removed the now redundant per mod Install/DownloadPackagesLogic
data.body: as it is identical to the RAInstallLogic since #3676 which is also shared with the Tiberian Sun mod so it was also time to give it a more generic name.

data.title: Fix helicopter reloading
Helipad landing is borked
data.body: Found a game breaking glitch when test playing a match with the ra mod on current bleed: heli pads don't rearm anymore and multiple helis spawn over each other.

data.title: Update packaging for recent website changes.
data.body: See https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRAWeb/pull/53.

data.title: Install optional movies and scores from CD
data.body:
So not finished just yet, but its working for the allies and soviet CDs.

Just looking for feedback and such to make sure im not doing anything terribly wrong (yes i realize the menu logic .cs file is named wrong).

What it does is let the user select a CD which they can install movie files and additional scores from, checks the disc based on a SHA1, installs the required content. Doing this in the main menu causes it to freeze and then speed up once the hash is obtained from the disc and the files are copied. If this is all looking good we should look at where the buttons and things should go, and i'll work on trying to get the scores from the expansions which so far seems to conflict with the scores.mix file included in the base game.

data.title: demo truck + water transport incorrect behavior
data.body:
If a water transport containing demo truck is destroyed, an area on the ground, where demo truck was last seen before entering transport, explodes.
Example replay (a moment at ~11:35): http://content.open-ra.org/?p=detail&table=replays&id=87

data.title: More RA balance work
Fixes two cosmetical issues with RA mod
data.body: Downsizes Ant selection box fixing #3885, and corrects Paradrop description which only says rifleman even though two Rocket Soldiers are dropped as well.

data.title: Installing from CD fails because of file name case (Linux)
data.body:
Installing content from CD failed for me, the code has all the file names in capitals, but on my system / CD the files all are in lowercase. The mismatched case causes the CD install to fail at the disc verification.

I'm wondering if maybe some CDs the file names are different? In my case my RA discs are from C&C Worldwide Warfare.

data.title: Game crash on Ubuntu
data.body:
Was just testing out OpenRA on Ubuntu using mono (as described in the FAQ), playing a singleplayer game against an Easy AI. Before I could get a war factory out, the game crashed. Here's the log:

Exception of type `System.ArrayTypeMismatchException`: Source array type cannot be assigned to destination array type.
  at (wrapper stelemref) object:virt_stelemref_interface (intptr,object)
  at System.Linq.SortSequenceContext`2[OpenRA.Graphics.IRenderable,OpenRA.Graphics.IRenderable].Initialize (OpenRA.Graphics.IRenderable[] elements) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.Linq.QuickSort`1[OpenRA.Graphics.IRenderable].PerformSort () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.Linq.QuickSort`1+<Sort>c__Iterator21[OpenRA.Graphics.IRenderable].MoveNext () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.Linq.Enumerable+<CreateConcatIterator>c__Iterator1`1[OpenRA.Graphics.IRenderable].MoveNext () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.Collections.Generic.List`1[OpenRA.Graphics.IRenderable].AddEnumerable (IEnumerable`1 enumerable) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.Collections.Generic.List`1[OpenRA.Graphics.IRenderable]..ctor (IEnumerable`1 collection) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToList[IRenderable](IEnumerable`1 source) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.GenerateRenderables () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

data.title: Brought back concrete walls in D2k
data.body: Reported by @ezequielgarcia via IRC. Introduced by #3676. Fixed here.

data.body: introduced in #3741 seen in many current reports like #3845 and #3879.
